subject: 60 Minutes E-mail Alert
body:
CBSNews.com












  Home | U.S. | World | Politics | SciTech | Health | Entertainment | Business | Opinion | Sports | Blogs | Interactives | Video 

  The Early Show | CBS Evening News | 48 Hours | 60 Minutes | The Saturday Early Show | CBS Sunday Morning | Face The Nation 






He has claimed to 
      have assisted in the suicides of 130 people, flouting authorities until he 
      ultimately dared them and ignited a ferocious national debate by coming on 
      60 Minutes with a videotape 
      he'd made of himself lethally injecting a patient. Dr. Jack Kevorkian 
      finally went to jail based on that tape and interview. Correspondent Emeritus Mike 
      Wallace was there with him in 1998, and he's there again in Sunday’s 
      lead story to talk to Kevorkian upon his release from a Michigan prison after more than eight 
      years. Has prison time and a parole agreement dulled the 79-year-old 
      pathologist’s passion to fight for legalization of physician assisted 
      suicide? Wallace gets to the heart of that and more when Dr. 
      Kevorkian comes on 60 Minutes once again to push 
      an agenda some call mercy killing and others, including the law in 49 
      states, call murder.
 
In our second story you will 
      hear from another passionate voice from the past who is up to new things 
      but still has the old fire. Up for a Tony Award for her solo 
      performance in a play based on the Joan Didion best-selling book “The Year 
      of Magical Thinking,” Vanessa Redgrave talks to Wallace for the first time 
      since 1979, when she appeared on 60 Minutes at the peak of her 
      political activism. After 28 years, she's still feisty - and so is 
      Wallace.
 
For our third story, it gets 
      even feistier when 60 Minutes re-broadcasts parts 
      of the exclusive and rare interview Wallace did last year with Iranian 
      President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad.  Now that U.S.-Iranian diplomatic 
      relations have been re-established for the first time in three decades and 
      with the question of an Iranian nuclear weapon still in an issue, 
      Wallace’s interview is as timely as ever. 
 
See this Mike Wallace tour de force and a 
      special Andy Rooney tribute to 
      Wallace, this Sunday, June 3, on 60 Minutes at 7 p.m. 
      ET/PT.
